Texts.Chs: 我被迫开口说话，因为科学家们不知道为什么就是拒绝听从我的建议。我完全不情愿地讲述了我反对这种计划中对南极入侵的理由，因为这种入侵涉及大规模的化石搜寻，以及对古代冰盖的大规模钻孔和融化——其实我更不情愿，因为我的警告可能是徒劳的。对确切事实的怀疑，正如我必须揭示它们，是不可避免的; 然而，如果我掩盖那些看起来过分和不可思议的东西，就会一无所有。
Texts.Eng: I am forced into speech because men of science have refused to follow my advice without knowing why. It is altogether against my will that I tell my reasons for opposing this contemplated invasion of the antarctic with its vast fossil-hunt and its wholesale boring and melting of the ancient ice-cap—and I am the more reluctant because my warning may be in vain. Doubt of the real facts, as I must reveal them, is inevitable; yet if I suppressed what will seem extravagant and incredible there would be nothing left.

Texts.Chs: 最后，我必须依靠少数几位科学领袖的判断和地位，他们一方面有足够的思想独立性来衡量我的数据本身令人难以置信的优点，或者根据某些原始的而困惑不解的神话周期来衡量; 另一方面他们也有足够的影响力来阻止整个探索者界在这些疯狂的山脉地区进行任何鲁莽和过于雄心勃勃的计划。
Texts.Eng: In the end I must rely on the judgment and standing of the few scientific leaders who have, on the one hand, sufficient independence of thought to weigh my data on its own hideously convincing merits or in the light of certain primordial and highly baffling myth-cycles; and on the other hand, sufficient influence to deter the exploring world in general from any rash and overambitious programme in the region of those mountains of madness. It is an unfortunate fact that relatively obscure men like myself and

Texts.Chs: 迄今为止保留下来的照片，无论是普通的还是空中拍摄的，都将对我有利，因为它们非常绘声绘色。尽管如此，这些照片还是会受到怀疑，因为聪明的造假者可以为所欲为。水墨画，当然，会被嘲笑为明显的骗局，尽管艺术专家应该评论和思考一些奇怪的技巧。
Texts.Eng: The hitherto withheld photographs, both ordinary and aerial, will count in my favour; for they are damnably vivid and graphic. Still, they will be doubted because of the great lengths to which clever fakery can be carried. The ink drawings, of course, will be jeered at as obvious impostures; notwithstanding a strangeness of technique which art experts ought to remark and puzzle over.

Texts.Chs: 这是一个不幸的事实，像我和我的合伙们人这样相对默默无闻的人，只和一所小型大学有联系，很少有机会给人留下深刻印象，尤其是在那些极其怪异或极具争议性的事件上。
Texts.Eng: my associates, connected only with a small university, have little chance of making an impression where matters of a wildly bizarre or highly controversial nature are concerned.
